intro: Hirschfeldia gallica, commonly known as the Galician hirschfeldia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. It produces capsules as its fruit, containing numerous tiny seeds. Hirschfeldia gallica is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
